Access to browser cookie storage files o.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 4656
Access to browser cookie storage files o.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 4663 and 4656 on endpoints for access attempts to known browser cookie database paths (e.g., %APPDATA%\\..\\Local\\<Browser>\\User Data\\Default\\Cookies). Identify processes attempting this access. Use statistical analysis (e.g., frequency distribution) to detect unusual access patterns by processes or users not typically interacting with these files.

Attempts to inject into or dump browser.Data: Windows Event ID 4656, Windows Event ID 4688
Attempts to inject into or dump browser.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4656 on endpoints, filtering for handle requests targeting browser processes (e.g., chrome.exe, firefox.exe). Analyze access masks requested to identify attempts related to process memory dumping or injection. Correlate with Windows Event ID 4688 to identify suspicious process creations (e.g., procdump) preceding or concurrent with such access attempts.
